alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN...SOUTHWESTERN POWDER RIVER...SOUTH CENTRAL ROSEBUD AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM MDT... At 743 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms near Sheridan, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall will cause a quick and significant drop in visibility, along with ponding of water on roadways, making travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Clearmont, Birney, Leiter, Wyola, Tongue River Reservoir, Banner, Arvada, Kirby, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Ucross, Parkman, and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
